headline: Berkshire Hathaway May Sell Stock in Kraft Heinz, Filing States
summary: Berkshire Hathaway  may sell shares from its $7.8 billion equity stake in  Kraft Heinz  according to a prospectus filed late Tuesday with the Securities and Exchange Commission.  The front page of the prospectus says that Berkshire, which received the Kraft Heinz equity as part of a merger of Kraft and Heinz in 2015, may “offer to sell from time to time” shares from that stake.  Berkshire now holds a 27.5% stake in the food company—or 325.4 million shares.

content.title: Berkshire Hathaway May Sell Stock in Kraft Heinz, Filing States
content.summary: Berkshire Hathaway  may sell shares from its $7.8 billion equity stake in  Kraft Heinz  according to a prospectus filed late Tuesday with the Securities and Exchange Commission.  The front page of the prospectus says that Berkshire, which received the Kraft Heinz equity as part of a merger of Kraft and Heinz in 2015, may “offer to sell from time to time” shares from that stake.  Berkshire now holds a 27.5% stake in the food company—or 325.4 million shares.

headline: Warren Buffett's successor eyes selling off Berkshire Hathaway's 325 million Kraft Heinz shares
summary: Warren Buffett's successor appears to be considering his first significant move after taking over as CEO this month.  Kraft Heinz warned investors Tuesday that Berkshire Hathaway may be interested in selling its 325 million shares in the name brand food giant that Buffett helped create back in 2015.  Buffett and the Brazilian investment firm 3G Capital orchestrated the merger of Kraft and Heinz back then because they already owned Heinz and believed in the power of their brands.

thumbnail.caption: FILE - Warren Buffett, Chairman and CEO of Berkshire Hathaway, speaks to reporters before presiding over the annual shareholders meeting in Omaha, Neb., May 4, 2019. (AP Photo/Nati Harnik, File)
